result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damian Carmona Jr.

records.addlTxt: Court will be down on 12-15-2022.  Court rescheduled plea/sentencing hearing.  Parties notified of new date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Damian Carmona Jr. not in court, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen appeared by video for Damian Carmona Jr.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Damian Carmona in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Damian Carmona in custody at HOC.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Damian Carmona appeared by video means with Attorney.  Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of case #21CF4332. Sworn for the State: Greenfield PD Officer J. Jackett. State rests.  Defense rests. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Damian Carmona in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Damian Carmona in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Damian Carmona appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
